name: Escape from Inferos
description:
Escape from Inferos is a 2D shooter, where you must tackle hell's guards head on with a select fire arm.

Watch out, for some enemies are stronger and more unique than others.

Controls:

WASD/Arrow Keys - Movement
Mouse - Direction of player
Left click - Fire weapon
R - Reload

Weapon Info:

[VERY EASY] MAC10 - Fully automatic, decent damage, decent reload, OCCASIONALLY goes through enemy shields.
[NORMAL] Magnum - Single fire, fantastic damage, SLOW reload, ALWAYS goes through enemy shields.
[HARD] Pistol - Single fire, decent damage, decent reload, RARELY goes through enemy shields.

Developer Notes:

I would have liked to implement far more levels, along with a level selector in the main menu, but out of fear of running out of time, and creating more bugs, I decided not to. I also considered adding a tutorial to the game, but due to real life events (holidays,) I had a more strict time schedule.

I also realized that using Raycasts to handle shooting would likely have been more wise, as the MAC-10's automatic fire can be a bit... off.

Another problem I noticed after compiling the game was that I did not properly scale my UI elements correctly. I hope to improve my UI in my upcoming projects.

I apologize for being unable to provide a WebGL build of the game, I was compiling the game and Unity just didn't want to output the files. I hope to resolve this problem for future game jams.

That's all for now, and I hope to see all of you in the next Weekly Game Jam! 
- liver man
